basics.name: Thibaud Colas
basics.label: Full-Stack Developer
basics.summary:
Hi!
\I'm Thibaud, a Software Engineer specialized in Web technologies. I contribute to the OSS community and enjoy writing and talking about my discoveries on the Web Platform.

I just moved to New Zealand and am actively looking for a Web-related Developer position in Auckland. I'm a french national with a one-year renewable Work Visa.

work.summary: Lead of a six-person team during functional / technical design and development of an e-commerce portal (500 man-days). International project with teams in France, Denmark, Sweden. Consulting and technical expertise activities at all stages of the project.
highlights: Participation to bids on technologically innovative projects (AngularJS, microservices).
Participation to the company's Excellence Team and to tooling and process improvement campaigns.
LAMP, UNIX, SOAP, REST, Angular, RWD, Jenkins, Vagrant, Git, Redmine, JIRA, Scrum

work.summary: Web Application Development — Participation to PHP development projects with the CGI Web Factory, from design to maintenance.Technical referee on two portal maintenance projects. Drupal 7, RWD, team of six developers.
highlights: LAMP, UNIX, SOAP, REST, Angular, RWD, Jenkins, Vagrant, Git, Redmine, JIRA, Scrum

work.summary: Organization of three groups in a Computer Science initiation class (Bachelor's degree) and a JavaScript class (Master's degree).

Design and development of new features for Datalift, as part of an internship. Datalift is a linked data publication platform for the Semantic Web. Data Visualization and transformation in the SemWeb spirit, JEE and SPA (Knockout).
highlights: JEE, Knockout, Bootstrap, D3, SPARQL, Sesame, Git

work.summary:
Integration, Development and Webmastering as part of an internship for the end of the DUT.
SEO optimization, UX and accessibility for existing websites. 
Contact with clients and teamwork with the Webmaster and designers.
highlights: PHP, MySQL, JS, jQuery, SEO, UX, accessibility, hosting, Photoshop

awards.title: JS1K 2014 — Honorable Mention
awards.summary: Honorable Mention by the JS1K Jury for Dragonsnake, a mash-up between snake and fruit ninja written in less than 1K (1012bytes) of JavaScript!

awards.title: Montpellier Unlimited Hackathon — Second Prize
awards.summary: Second Prize for a public transport route calculation app (handles tramway, buses and bikes) in the Montpellier Area. Cross-platform app built with Sencha Touch and Cordova. Node.js backend dispatching transportation data from data repositories (time tables) and SOAP/REST services (real time data, weather data).

publications.name: ES6: Quick Wins
publications.summary: Lightning talk that I gave at Mix-IT 2014, describing three quick and simple ways to use new JavaScript features today.

publications.name: Node.js: platform overview
publications.summary: A broad overview of the Node.js platform, to get my coworkers hooked.

publications.name: Browser Performance: The Critical Path
publications.summary: Inspired by a talk I heard at the Takeoff conference, a presentation on the Critical Path in page rendering and how to optimize it.

references.name: Anthony Dardilhac — Project Lead & Head of tooling — CGI WebFactory
references.reference: Thibaud is an avid developer. He quickly grasps complex problems and goes beyond the expectations of his managers. Thanks to his great coaching skills and clear explanations, he helped his colleagues to improve themselves. It's a pleasure to work with him and I recommend him with my eyes closed.
